DataElement.preferredName: SPECT Whole Body Planar Imaging Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not planar whole body SPECT imaging was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography Whole Body Scan Planar Imaging Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A type of tomography in which gamma photon-emitting radionuclides are administered to the patient and then detected by one or more gamma cameras rotated around the patient. From the series of two-dimensional images produced, a three-dimensional image can be created by computer reconstruction._A series of scans of a subject taken at sequential bed positions as the bed moves through the scanner. The images, each limited by an axial field of view, can then be pieced together to give an extended length image of the subject. A whole body scan contrasts with a single bed position scan in which only a rather limited region within the subject is to be studied._Implementation of a gamma camera to obtain 2D images with no tomographic reconstruction process being involved._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of tomography in which gamma photon-emitting radionuclides are administered to the patient and then detected by one or more gamma cameras rotated around the patient. From the series of two-dimensional images produced, a three-dimensional image can be created by computer reconstruction.

Concepts.definition: A type of tomography in which gamma photon-emitting radionuclides are administered to the patient and then detected by one or more gamma cameras rotated around the patient. From the series of two-dimensional images produced, a three-dimensional image can be created by computer reconstruction.

Property.preferredName: Whole Body Scan Planar Imaging Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: A series of scans of a subject taken at sequential bed positions as the bed moves through the scanner. The images, each limited by an axial field of view, can then be pieced together to give an extended length image of the subject. A whole body scan contrasts with a single bed position scan in which only a rather limited region within the subject is to be studied.:Implementation of a gamma camera to obtain 2D images with no tomographic reconstruction process being involved.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A series of scans of a subject taken at sequential bed positions as the bed moves through the scanner. The images, each limited by an axial field of view, can then be pieced together to give an extended length image of the subject. A whole body scan contrasts with a single bed position scan in which only a rather limited region within the subject is to be studied.
Implementation of a gamma camera to obtain 2D images with no tomographic reconstruction process being involved.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
